title: NameError: name 'long' is not defined
body_html:
An error occurs when using torchvision.utils.make_grid().And the error message is .

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/keith/PycharmProjects/JData/test.py", line 42, in <module>
    res = make_grid(imgs)
  File "/home/keith/.virtualenvs/pp/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torchvision/utils.py", line 28, in make_grid
    size = torch.Size(torch.Size([long(numImages)]) + tensorlist[0].size())
NameError: name 'long' is not defined

Then , i was trying to figure out why this happed and i found in stackoverflow where a people say In Python 3.x, use int instead of long. Is it a solution for this problem?

body:
An error occurs when using `torchvision.utils.make_grid()`.And the error message is .
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/keith/PycharmProjects/JData/test.py", line 42, in <module>
    res = make_grid(imgs)
  File "/home/keith/.virtualenvs/pp/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torchvision/utils.py", line 28, in make_grid
    size = torch.Size(torch.Size([long(numImages)]) + tensorlist[0].size())
NameError: name 'long' is not defined
```
Then , i was trying to figure out why this happed  and i found in [stackoverflow](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14904814/nameerror-global-name-long-is-not-defined) where a people say `In Python 3.x, use int instead of long.` Is it a solution for this problem?
